ever before to innovate faster and to
drive the innovation in the news
industry that's necessary for our

space I'm gr tley I'm director of
architecture at Guardian news and media
Guardian news and media is a news
organization we first published a
newspaper about 200 years ago and now we
also reached the whole the world through
our website and our apps before we moved
to the cloud we ran our own day centers
we had all of our uh software
infrastructure was all running uh
ourselves so we forced people around the
world to come back to our officers
effectively to visit our website as a
media organization we're facing massive
change uh in the industry in the way
people are choosing to consume news and
we were finding that we simply could not
innovate fast enough to keep up with
those changes about 4 years ago we
realized we had to do something
different so we started running some of
our new services on Amazon web services
we believe there are two things that are
absolutely critical to the future of our
business number one is our content the
journalism that we produce number two is
understanding how people consume that
content and so we've put a lot of effort
into using tools like uh Kinesis and red
shift to be able to uh process that data
and understanding the way in which
people interact with our
website the biggest benefit for us of
running things on the cloud is it
enables us as an engineering team to in
innovate much much faster we're able to
cut out a lot of the delays that we used
to have in trying to provision new
Services whether they're ones that we
intend to be core services or ones that
we're just experimenting with we're able
to deliver those much much faster than
we ever have done before we built a tool
called ofan to give give feedback to our
editors and journalists in real time of
who was consuming what content on our
website ofan is totally hosted on AWS
and we wouldn't have been able to build
it without the auto scaling uh and fast
provisioning that AWS gives us because
we we just didn't know what the traffic
was going to be like we didn't know what
the load of the processing was like and
we were able to incrementally build it
and evolve it uh into the tool that is
today in 2012 uh we made 25 releases uh
in their production in 2014 uh we made
about 40,000 releases because we're
continuous releasing drawing the day as
each individual team completes a piece
of work ads has made my job a lot easier
because teams can self-service uh choose
their infrastructure provision it for
themselves with minimal guidance from
the architecture team my advice to
anybody thinking about moving to AWS is
is go for it uh it's been
transformational
